references.reason: This paper is foundational for the theoretical analysis of low-rank matrix completion, a crucial subroutine used in the proposed algorithm.

references.paper_title: Noisy matrix completion: Understanding statistical guarantees for convex relaxation via nonconvex optimization
references.reason: This paper provides strong entrywise guarantees for noisy low-rank matrix completion, which directly inspired the matrix estimation method used here.

references.paper_title: Sample efficient reinforcement learning via low-rank matrix estimation
references.reason: This paper introduced the idea of using low-rank structure in reinforcement learning for sample efficiency, providing a direct comparison for the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Minimax pac bounds on the sample complexity of reinforcement learning with a generative model
references.reason: This paper establishes the minimax sample complexity lower bound for reinforcement learning, providing a benchmark against which the sample complexity of the proposed method can be evaluated.
This book provides foundational concepts and algorithms in approximate dynamic programming, the core methodology underlying the proposed reinforcement learning algorithm.
